searchDocs.title: What Can Go Wrong‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If jquery.js is loaded with the defer attribute, it may delay jQuery's availability, causing the QA Assistant script to run before jQuery is ready. This can lead to:  Tracking data not being recorded ("no data")Heatmaps failing to display, even though page data existsJavaScript errors that may interfere with other plugins

searchDocs.title: How to Avoid This‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To ensure proper functionality, please consider one of the following approaches:  Do not apply defer to jQuery. This is the most reliable way to preserve the correct script order. Include QA Assistant‚Äôs tracking script as part of your defer queue, but after jQuery. For example, if you are managing defer behavior in functions.php, be sure to include QA Assistant's scripts (qa-heatmap-analytics/js) after jQuery in the defer list.  üí° Based on internal testing, deferring jQuery can prevent the QA Assistant tracking script from initializing correctly.

searchDocs.title: Summary‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Always ensure that jQuery is available before the QA Assistant tracking script runs. This prevents loss of data and ensures your heatmaps and analytics work as expected.

searchDocs.title: What is QAL (Query Assistant Language)?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: At the heart of the API is QAL (Query Assistant Language) ‚Äî a language that empowers data-driven assistants to freely manipulate data. QAL is not a flexible language like SQL; it's specifically designed for QA's column-oriented structure.  QAL Design Philosophy:  Explicit Paths: Clearly describe the data reference path (Material ‚Üí View ‚Üí Result)Deterministic: The same query always returns the same resultMinimal Specification: Minimal syntax that neither AI nor humans can misunderstand

searchDocs.title: QAL Basic Structure‚Äã
searchDocs.content: A QAL query consists of four elements:  materials: Specify the source data (materials)time: Explicitly specify the analysis period (relative specifications not allowed)make: Build intermediate views step by step from materialsresult: Specify the final view to return

searchDocs.title: A QAL Example‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here's how you request page view aggregation for blog pages:  { "tracking_id": "your-site-id", "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-31T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "blog_pages": { "from": ["allpv"], "filter": { "and": [ { "like": { "col": "allpv.url", "val": "%/blog/%" } }, { "eq": { "col": "allpv.device_type", "val": "smp" } } ] }, "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"], "calc": { "pageviews": "COUNT(allpv.pv_id)", "sessions": "COUNTUNIQUE(allpv.reader_id)" } } }, "result": { "use": "blog_pages", "sort": [{ "by": "pageviews", "dir": "desc" }], "limit": 10 } }   How This Query Works:  Retrieve data from October 2025 using the allpv materialFilter for data where URL contains "/blog/" and device type is mobile (smp)Aggregate page views and sessions by URLReturn top 10 results sorted by page views in descending order

searchDocs.title: 1. Explicit Time Specification‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QAL does not allow relative time specifications (like "yesterday" or "last week"). You must always specify concrete dates and times:  "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-31T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }   This ensures that the same results are always obtained regardless of when the query is executed.

searchDocs.title: 2. Explicit Data Paths‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In QAL, you build the data flow step by step:  "make": { "step1": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.reader_id"], "filter": { "and": [ { "like": { "col": "allpv.url", "val": "%/blog/%" } } ] } }, "step2": { "from": ["step1"], "keep": ["step1.url"], "calc": { "sessions": "COUNTUNIQUE(step1.reader_id)" } } }   This step-by-step construction makes it easier to debug than complex SQL and easier for AI to generate.

searchDocs.title: 3. Limited Aggregation Functions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QAL supports only the following six aggregation functions:  COUNT(column) - Count rowsCOUNTUNIQUE(column) - Count unique valuesSUM(column) - Calculate sumAVERAGE(column) - Calculate averageMIN(column) - Get minimum valueMAX(column) - Get maximum value  This limitation ensures predictable and safe query execution.

searchDocs.title: 4. Fully Qualified Names‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Column names must always be specified in the format <material_name>.<column_name> or <view_name>.<column_name>:  "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"], "calc": { "pageviews": "COUNT(allpv.pv_id)" }

searchDocs.title: 2. Campaign Performance Measurement‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Analyze performance by UTM campaign:  { "tracking_id": "your-site-id", "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-31T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "campaign_performance": { "from": ["allpv"], "filter": { "and": [ { "like": { "col": "allpv.utm_campaign", "val": "%sale%" } } ] }, "keep": ["allpv.utm_campaign", "allpv.utm_source"], "calc": { "sessions": "COUNTUNIQUE(allpv.reader_id)", "pageviews": "COUNT(allpv.pv_id)", "avg_time": "AVERAGE(allpv.page_msec)" } } }, "result": { "use": "campaign_performance", "sort": [{ "by": "sessions", "dir": "desc" }], "limit": 20 } }   How This Query Works:  Retrieve data from October 2025 using the allpv materialFilter for traffic where UTM campaign contains "sale"Aggregate sessions, page views, and average dwell time by campaign and sourceReturn top 20 results sorted by sessions in descending order

searchDocs.title: QA Assistant's Approach‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA Assistant offers a slightly different perspective on utilizing website data.  Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and other excellent tools excel at detailed data analysis and strategic decision-making. QA Assistant, on the other hand, focuses on daily website operations, aiming to understand data and suggest specific next actions.  For example, for everyday content updates or social media posting decisions, QA Assistant's concrete action suggestions might be helpful. At the same time, when developing business strategy, you might perform deeper analysis with GA4's exploration reports and custom dimensions ‚Äî this kind of role division is one approach.  QA Assistant can be used in combination with existing tools like GA4. We hope you'll consider it as one option for supporting your website's growth while leveraging each tool's strengths.
